body_html:
ok. i didn't realise that I could dynamically add a dependency to a target in any dir (using backend_data). i will change my code to look very similar to that (where the contents of the backend_args and backend_data are added from the plugin config.

don't worry about the C++ tests. i don't run them for my own backend right now because too many are failing. I looked,briefly, at some of the failures. I saw some 64 bit assumptions and some things that we don't support currently. i'm not too worried at the moment.
body_text:

don't worry about the C++ tests. i don't run them for my own backend right now because too many are failing.  I looked,briefly, at some of the failures.  I saw some 64 bit assumptions and some things that we don't support currently.  i'm not too worried at the moment.
body:
ok.  i didn't realise that I could dynamically add a dependency to a target in any dir (using backend_data).   i will change my code to look very similar to that (where the contents of the backend_args and backend_data are added from the plugin config.

don't worry about the C++ tests. i don't run them for my own backend right now because too many are failing.  I looked,briefly, at some of the failures.  I saw some 64 bit assumptions and some things that we don't support currently.  i'm not too worried at the moment.
